snippet: As civilian deaths drop, firefighters continue to be killed or wounded inside burning buildings where no civilians are killed.
abstract: New York City officials report 58 fire deaths in the city in 2012, a record low attributed to faster response times, more intensive training and extensive public contacts; fatalities represent a sharp decrease from the 1980s, when it was common for more than 200 people to die in fires each year.
lead_paragraph: As civilian deaths drop, firefighters continue to be killed or wounded inside burning buildings where no civilians are killed.

headline.seo: 58 Fire Deaths in New York City in 2012, Record Low
headline.main: City’s 58 Fire Deaths in ’12 Are Lowest on Record
headline.print_headline: New York’s 58 Fire Deaths in 2012 Are Lowest on Record; Many Victims Were 70 or Older
